definition: to change/to become different/to transform/to vary/rebellion
in confusion or disorder/in a confused state of mind/disorder/upheaval/riot/illicit sexual relations/to throw into disorder/to mix up/indiscriminate/random/arbitrary

sentences.english: There was a serious train accident near the border. Two people were killed and twelve were injured.
sentences.chinese: 疆域發生緊張列車變亂，二人滅亡，十二人負傷。

sentences.english: Centuries ago, mankind rebelled against God. The result was confusion.
sentences.chinese: 許多年前，人類背叛了上帝，結果就是變亂。

sentences.english: Educators are who can make hard things easy.
sentences.chinese: 教育者總能使艱苦之變亂得簡易。

sentences.english: General Newton: I dont know the difference between Picasso and a car crash.
sentences.chinese: 我看不出畢加索的畫和一場交通變亂有什麼不同。

sentences.english: Thee accident took place one hour ago in the Eleven Avenue.
sentences.chinese: 一小時前十一號大街產生了一場變亂。

sentences.english: Note that the layout of some pages can get messed up.
sentences.chinese: 注意有些頁面的佈局可能會變亂七捌糟。

sentences.english: She was the only person that saw the accident.
sentences.chinese: 她是獨一自己看眼見那場變亂的人。

sentences.english: Every time I clean up my room, it goes untidy itself. It's so strange.
sentences.chinese: 每次我打掃完房間，它都會自己變亂，真奇怪。

sentences.english: At the Tower of Babel, God confused the languages.
sentences.chinese: 在巴別塔，神變亂了口音。

definition: Liuying township in Tainan county 台南縣|台南县[Tai2 nan2 xian4], Taiwan
to be buried in a horse hide (idiom)/to give one's life on the battlefield
the State of Qǐ in modern Qǐ county 杞縣|杞县, Henan (c. 1500-445 BC), a small vassal state of Shang and Western Zhou for most of its existence
to dispatch troops/to send an army/to mobilize forces
to involve others (in a crime)/guilt by association
using the few to defeat the many (idiom); to win from a position of weakness
lit. to return the jade annulus to Zhao (idiom); fig. to return something intact to its rightful owner
Qin Hui (1090-1155 AD), Song Dynasty official said to have betrayed General Yue Fei 岳飛|岳飞[Yue4 Fei1]
Zou Yan (305-240 BC), founder of the School of Yin-Yang of the Warring States Period (475-221 BC)
to feel hatred/to harbor a grudge
